results.content: Thank you. For the most part, this course kept me engaged. I did have a little trouble here and there understanding the instructor and a couple of the videos seemed to be in different formats. This caused me to have to adjust the volume in order to hear them. It's definitely a great course if you are a beginner.  I feel like I have a better understanding of HTML. One recommendation, maybe discuss the differences between HTML 4 and 5.
results.content_html: Thank you. For the most part, this course kept me engaged. I did have a little trouble here and there understanding the instructor and a couple of the videos seemed to be in different formats. This caused me to have to adjust the volume in order to hear them. It's definitely a great course if you are a beginner. I feel like I have a better understanding of HTML. One recommendation, maybe discuss the differences between HTML 4 and 5.

results.content:
If you are a beginner and looking for a place to start learning HTML from scratch this is the right place for you!
The only suggestion for the instructor would be to get a better preparation for each lecture and go straight to the point and maybe do a second try if something goes wrong during recording  because making corrections during your lecture may confuse some student. In some cases it might be helpful as well (seeing attempts of failures and success afterwards).
The final word would be that this is a great course overall. I can't wait to see the course about CSS.
results.content_html:
If you are a beginner and looking for a place to start learning HTML from scratch this is the right place for you!
The only suggestion for the instructor would be to get a better preparation for each lecture and go straight to the point and maybe do a second try if something goes wrong during recording because making corrections during your lecture may confuse some student. In some cases it might be helpful as well (seeing attempts of failures and success afterwards).
The final word would be that this is a great course overall. I can't wait to see the course about CSS.

results.content: The course is engaging and useful for beginners. The narration is pleasant. Lots of useful information is imparted in a short time. The software used, Brackets, is easy to use. I would be leary of calling myself "expert" after completing the course, however.
results.content_html: The course is engaging and useful for beginners. The narration is pleasant. Lots of useful information is imparted in a short time. The software used, Brackets, is easy to use. I would be leary of calling myself "expert" after completing the course, however.

I like how the instructor takes his time to explain everything in detail. I am familiar for most of HTML. However, if I were a beginner, never having to use HTML, I would find the lecture to be a little fast pace.

If I were to offer any criticism, I would say to slow down.

results.content:
alright alright alright alright alright alright alright alright . oops oops oops oops oops oops oops oops . some information are simply wrong. headings are not used to have a different text size. at the same point you usually do not bold text with strong tags etc.
are normally replaced by padding and margin via css. you should emphasize that html is intended only to structure the content of your web page. the rest or rather the styling is done by css, the user interaction is done by js or something else. the title of your course is totally wrong. you are definetly not an expert after complete these lectures. and the html5 knowledge is very limited. there is much more html5 has to offer. for the very first overview of html the course is ok.
results.content_html:
alright alright alright alright alright alright alright alright .
oops oops oops oops oops oops oops oops .

some information are simply wrong. headings are not used to have a different text size. at the same point you usually do not bold text with strong tags etc.
are normally replaced by padding and margin via css.

you should emphasize that html is intended only to structure the content of your web page. the rest or rather the styling is done by css, the user interaction is done by js or something else.

the title of your course is totally wrong. you are definetly not an expert after complete these lectures. and the html5 knowledge is very limited. there is much more html5 has to offer.

for the very first overview of html the course is ok.

results.content:
It's a good beginner course. His english is slightly broken. I breezed through much of this, as I realized that after enrolling this is about equivalent to a 100 level course in a Community College. There is certainly more to be learned in HTML than what is presented here in the advanced, but it's free, so I still gave it a high rating. This guy didn't have to do this. And he describes the ul li relationship very well. 

Just understand, students who are looking to learn: HTML has many ways of communicating with other programming languages, and it's important to know them if you want to make HTML build dynamic, interactive websites.
results.content_html:

Just understand, students who are looking to learn: HTML has many ways of communicating with other programming languages, and it's important to know them if you want to make HTML build dynamic, interactive websites.

results.content:
Let's start by saying that I know HTML, CSS, JS, and Web Development in general.  I enrolled this course, as I do with other courses, because I believe I can always learn something new, and furthermore, being a 'real' teacher myself (not a lecturer in Udemy), maybe I can get good ideas how to better teach my own students.  That been said, being as much respectful as possible regarding the lecturer, I must write that this is NOT a good course, not whether it's offered for free,  and especially not as a paid one.
- The lecturer's level of English is just too low.  Yep, I know, it's all about HTML and not about English grammatical issues, but one just cannot ignore these so-called small mistakes.
- Claiming that the course makes one a HTML expert is nothing less than ridiculous.  The topics are not tied together to anything that even looks like a site, and yes, it's possible to design a nice HTML site without using even a single CSS  line.  Yet, it's possible to build a site, let the learners see how it looks without CSS, and then explain that for the sake of visibility some CSS will be used even though it haven't been taught.  What's the point in teaching the CLASS & ID attributes or the DIV & SPAN tags if the learner can only guess, not to say decipher the not-too-good-English, what they are used for?  Using IFRAME to embed a video in a page? C'mon dude, even in 2016 one could use the VIDEO tag for that.

In summary, I cannot judge the lecturer's Web Development skills, and I tend to believe that he knows what he is talking about, but as for teaching others, well, sadly, in my opinion, he's just not good.
results.content_html:
Let's start by saying that I know HTML, CSS, JS, and Web Development in general. I enrolled this course, as I do with other courses, because I believe I can always learn something new, and furthermore, being a 'real' teacher myself (not a lecturer in Udemy), maybe I can get good ideas how to better teach my own students. That been said, being as much respectful as possible regarding the lecturer, I must write that this is NOT a good course, not whether it's offered for free, and especially not as a paid one.
- The lecturer's level of English is just too low. Yep, I know, it's all about HTML and not about English grammatical issues, but one just cannot ignore these so-called small mistakes.
- Claiming that the course makes one a HTML expert is nothing less than ridiculous. The topics are not tied together to anything that even looks like a site, and yes, it's possible to design a nice HTML site without using even a single CSS line. Yet, it's possible to build a site, let the learners see how it looks without CSS, and then explain that for the sake of visibility some CSS will be used even though it haven't been taught. What's the point in teaching the CLASS & ID attributes or the DIV & SPAN tags if the learner can only guess, not to say decipher the not-too-good-English, what they are used for? Using IFRAME to embed a video in a page? C'mon dude, even in 2016 one could use the VIDEO tag for that.

In summary, I cannot judge the lecturer's Web Development skills, and I tend to believe that he knows what he is talking about, but as for teaching others, well, sadly, in my opinion, he's just not good.

results.content: Title says "Complete html developer course". Lessons are labelled as "beginner", "intermediate", "advanced" and "expert". There is absolutely nothing in this course that can be labelled as anything except beginner and it's very far from being complete even as a beginner course.  On the plus side the teacher seems very friendly and help some  and the course could be helpful for complete beginners.
results.content_html: Title says "Complete html developer course". Lessons are labelled as "beginner", "intermediate", "advanced" and "expert". There is absolutely nothing in this course that can be labelled as anything except beginner and it's very far from being complete even as a beginner course. On the plus side the teacher seems very friendly and help some and the course could be helpful for complete beginners.

results.content:
The teachings are quite okay. But they didn't cover some of the lectures i learned from other website liked iframe, scrolling & marquee.

Also, there were some of the time the lecturer didn't prepare in advanced or double check his articles before recording/proceeding with his teachings.

The accent is quite a struggle. First few lectures i have difficulties in understanding his teachings (in talkings). Therefore, i just muted the volume & displayed the subtitles.

Overall, this course is still acceptable for a beginner liked me & hopefully others as well.
results.content_html:
The teachings are quite okay. But they didn't cover some of the lectures i learned from other website liked iframe, scrolling & marquee.

Also, there were some of the time the lecturer didn't prepare in advanced or double check his articles before recording/proceeding with his teachings.

The accent is quite a struggle. First few lectures i have difficulties in understanding his teachings (in talkings). Therefore, i just muted the volume & displayed the subtitles.

Overall, this course is still acceptable for a beginner liked me & hopefully others as well.

results.content: Very happy with this course and the tutor. Everything was explained clearly, step by step.The tutor presented the contents in a concise and peaceful manner. I'll be coming back if I ever need a recap. Thank you for sharing your knowledge.

results.content:
Audio needs to be normalized.  Had to keep turning my volume up and down between the first few sections.

The course content is passable if, like me, you're looking just for a reminder of different basic HTML topics.  For someone who wants to learn HTML from scratch, it's definitely too basic to cover enough information to even get someone to the point where they can learn more on their own.
results.content_html:
Audio needs to be normalized. Had to keep turning my volume up and down between the first few sections.

The course content is passable if, like me, you're looking just for a reminder of different basic HTML topics. For someone who wants to learn HTML from scratch, it's definitely too basic to cover enough information to even get someone to the point where they can learn more on their own.
